oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Security Pawn, 2002 January
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Security Pawn, a pawnshop located at 3025 Nolensville Road in Nashville, Tennessee. Formerly Fourth Avenue Church of Christ, this building was erected in the 1930s. The church later changed its name to Nolensville Road Church of Christ before becoming home to Security Pawn. The foundation is rough cut stone blocks that have been painted grey. The exterior walls are concrete block that has been painted white. The gabled roof is made of tar shingles. The windows are large and square with clear glass panes. Security bars cover the exterior of each window. The doors are metal and glass. Special features include a one story concrete block addition at the rear of the building. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Security Pawn (Nashville, Tenn.); Fourth Avenue Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.); Nolensville Road Church of Christ (Nashville, Tenn.)
